title: Ted Henter
text:
Ted Henter is an American <a href="List%20of%20programmers">computer programmer</a> and <a href="businessperson">businessperson</a> known for having invented the <a href="JAWS%20%28screen%20reader%29">JAWS screen reader for the blind</a>. He studied engineering, but learned computer programming and started his own business after becoming <a href="blindness">blind</a> in a car accident in 1978, which put an end to a promising career as an international motorcycle racer.
In 1987, he teamed up with businessperson <a href="Bill%20Joyce%20%28disambiguation%29">Bill Joyce</a>, who together founded <a href="Henter-Joyce">Henter-Joyce</a> in St. Petersburg, Florida. Henter was president and led the operation and provided technology direction while Joyce acted as a silent partner. Henter-Joyce produced <a href="JAWS%20%28screen%20reader%29">JAWS</a>, a <a href="screen%20reader">screen reader</a> for personal computers using <a href="MS-DOS">MS-DOS</a>, and later <a href="Microsoft%20Windows">Microsoft Windows</a>.
After becoming blinded, Henter rediscovered waterskiing, and started competing in waterskiing events. He won six times out of seven competitions in the United States and twice in international competition. He retired in 1991 after winning the overall Gold medal in the United States and World Championship for Disabled Skiers.
Henter-Joyce merged with Arkenstone and <a href="Blazie%20Engineering">Blazie Engineering</a> in 2000 to form <a href="Freedom%20Scientific">Freedom Scientific</a>. Henter currently remains on the board of directors of Freedom Scientific, and in 2002 he founded <a href="Henter%20Math">Henter Math</a>, to produce software that helps the "pencil-impaired" with mathematics.
